metadata.title: CVE-2023-25751 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Sometimes, when invalidating JIT code while following an iterator, the newly generated code could be overwritten incorrectly. This could lead to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 111, Firefox ESR < 102.9, and Thunderbird < 102.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25751` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.9.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
